name: Freddy Fender
description:
'''Freddy Fender''' (born '''Baldemar Garza Huerta'''; June 4, 1937 â€“ October 14, 2006) was an American [[Country music|Country]] and [[Tejano music|Tejano]] singer, known for his work as a solo artist and in the groups [[Los Super Seven]] and the [[Texas Tornados]]. His signature sound fused [[country music|country]], [[rock music|rock]], [[swamp pop]] and [[Tejano music|Tex-Mex]] styles.

Active since the 1950s, when he got his start playing Spanish-language [[rock and roll]] for Tejano audiences, Fender's mainstream breakthrough came in 1975 with the crossover hit "[[Before the Next Teardrop Falls (song)|Before the Next Teardrop Falls]]," which topped ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s pop and country charts. He recorded further country hits such as "[[Wasted Days and Wasted Nights]]," "[[Secret Love (Doris Day song)|Secret Love]]," "[[You'll Lose a Good Thing]]," "[[Living It Down]]," and "[[The Rains Came (song)|The Rains Came]]."
